intro: Bignonia gratissima, commonly known as the golden glory vine, is a climbing plant native to the southeastern United States. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a strong, somewhat unpleasant odor. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Bignonia gratissima is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to cover trellises or walls.
